commit_message:
version 2.069 - April 2012

1. Modified the target regions to use the reference sequences
present in the BAM file.  If a list of BAM files is provided,
the reference sequences are taken from the first file in the
list.  It is currently the users reponsibility to ensure that
the BAM files all have the same reference sequences.

version 2.068 - December 2011

1. Ensured that the duplicate marked BAM file is deleted after renaming.

version 2.067

1. Minor fix to duplicate marking command line.

version 2.066 - December 2011

1. Allow the original base qualities to be retained in GATK base
quality recalibration by setting the -keep-orig-quals flag.

version 2.065 - November 2011

1. Added TMP_DIR to the Picard duplicate marking command line.  This
avoids spilling data onto the node if working on local disk.

version 2.064 - November 2011

1. Fixed typo in BCMMarkDupes command line.

version 2.063 - October 2011

1. Ensured that the neural net files are copied to the node with the
reference if necessary.

version 2.062 - October 2011

1. Bug fix for the BCMMarkDupes for 454 reads.

version 2.061 - October 2011

1. Added temp directory to the CountCovariates step in the GATK
base quality recalibration.

version 2.060 - September 2011

1. Added the neural net file requirement to Mosaik2.

version 2.059 - September 2011

1. Added -no-complex option.  This will force freebayes to not call
complex variants.

version 2.058 - September 2011

1. Added the -scratch <dir> option to the command line.  The default
location on the nodes is /scratch/<user>, but specifying this
command will change the directory to /<dir>/<user>.

2. Added the -fastq-list <list> option to the command line.  Instead
of searching for and checking that fastq files exist, the list of
fastq files in the specified list will be used.  The scripts will use
the path specified, so it is the users responsibility to ensure that
these files exist.

version 2.057 - August 2011

1. Added the command -snp-delimiter.  When SNP calling, target regions
of the form <chr>:<start>-<end> are created and are used in the command
line for some of the software tools.  The region also appears in the
filename.  Some systems do not like having ":" in the filename, so
using this command allows the user to specify a different character.
The software tools will still be given the expected region format.

version 2.056 - July 2011

1. Bug fix to base quality recalibration for SOLiD BAM files.  The
additional SOLiD command line arguments were present in the count
covariates step, but not in the table recalibration.  This has been
fixed.

version 2.055 - July 2011

1. Bug fix to base quality recalibration when the local option has
been defined.

version 2.054 - July 2011

1. BQ recalibration with the GATK was not being used for SOLiD reads
since there were problems getting Mosaik BAMs through the pipeline.
The problem has been addressed in Mosaik and so this step has been
reinstated.

version 2.053 - July 2011

1. Added ogap and bamleftalign to the list of tools whose location
can be specified using -software.

version 2.052 - July 2011

1. freeBayes, ogap and bamleftalign were hard coded into the scripts,
so their paths couldn't be altered.  This has been rectified.

2. When filtering on proper-pairs, mapping quality zero reads are also
filtered out.  All mapping quality zero paired end reads would already
be filtered out as having a non-zero mapping quality is a pre-requisite
for being a proper pair, however mapping quality zero single end reads
still required filtering out.  This is now implemented in the proper
pair json script.

version 2.051 - July 2011

1. Minor changes to SNP calling with freebayes to be compatible
with freebayes version 0.8.5.

version 2.050 - July 2011

1. Bug fix to BCM duplicate marking.

version 2.049 - July 2011

1. Updated base quality recalibration to use a dbSNP vcf file rather
than the rod file originally required.

version 2.048 - June 2011

1. When searching for unique merged bam files, the sample name and
technology appearing in multiple files causes a problems, as the
pipeline is unclear as to which existing bam file is the correct
file to carry forward.  In checking the names, the full path was
included, so if the technology/sample name appeared in a directory
name, an error was thrown and the pipeline terminated.  This has
been modified to only include the file name itself.

version 2.047 - June 2011

1. When searching for existing bam files, the additional bam files
from Mosaik2 are excluded.  Only the main bam file is searched for
and used in subsequent steps.

version 2.046 - June 2011

1. Minor modification to format of status output.

version 2.045 - June 2011

1. Included the -status option to view the status of the created
scripts.

version 2.044 - June 2011

1. Included an option to turn off proper pair marking.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:AlistairNWard/bosCoPipe

version 2.043 - June 2011

1. Modified the GATK java command line to reflect the available
memory.

version 2.042 - June 2011

1. Added a module to calculate the md5 checksum of the final merged
bam file.

version 0.43 - June 2011

1. Added a module to calculate the md5 checksum of the final merged
bam file.

version 2.041 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to base quality recalibration.  A command for the table
recalibration step was in the count covariates step causing errors.

version 2.040 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to modules.

version 2.039 - June 2011

1. Bug fix.  Definition of bamtools modules modified.  The different
tasks using bamtools all pointed to the same definitions, leading to
an incorrect directory being used for some tasks.  This had the effect
of using an incorrect directory in the merge scripts.

version 2.038 - June 2011

1. Removed output of original quality scores from the base quality
recalibration step.

version 2.037 - June 2011

1. By default, removed base quality recalibration for SOLiD
reads.  The option to force recalibration regardless of technology
exists with -bq-recal.

version 2.036 - June 2011

1. Included a check that the output directory for any task exists
and creates the directory if not.

version 2.035 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to setting the region size for SNP calling.

version 2.034 - June 2011

1. Included --use-best-n-alleles 0 as standard in the freeBayes command
line.  For some exome calls, it was observed that a 'correct' variant
allele was being superseded by another allele that happened to have a
larger sum of base qualities as a result of the high-depth/large
sample size.

version 2.033 - June 2011

1. Minor bug fix to -software.

version 2.032 - June 2011

1. Included help option to -software.

version 2.031 - June 2011

1. Created a new module for moving Mosaik2 bam files and
statistics file back to the local directory.

2. Duplicate marking had been erroneously omitted from the
SOLiD alignment pipeline.  Use of Picard for performing
duplicate marking is now included for SOLiD reads.

version 2.030 - June 2011

1. Removed -modules option.  This was unnecessary.

2. Fixed filename for Mosaik2 statistics file.

version 2.029 - June 2011

1. Added the -n option to bamtools sort.  This reduces the number
of created temp files, improving the efficiency of the sort and
negating problems with being unable to open too many files
simultaneously.

version 2.028 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to copying stats file.

version 2.027 - June 2011

1. Copy the stats file from Mosaik2 back to the local disk.

version 2.026 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to Mosaik2 aligner.

version 2.025 - June 2011

1. -ls was being added for single end reads in Mosaik2.  If this is
a true single end library, the value will be undefined causing the
Mosaik aligner to crash.

version 0.24 - June 2011

1. Add -modules option for Scorpio.  This adds the pathscale and
git modules to the scripts.

version 2.023 - June 2011

1. Bug fix to -memory.

version 2.022 - June 2011

1. Allowed a memory requirement for the node (-memory).

version 2.021 - June 2011

1. Bug fix with MosaikBuild for single end reads.  -mfl was being
included with no argument.

version 2.020 - June 2011

1. Included -local option.  This will set the $NODE_DIR to the
local disk, so that all I/O occurs on the local disk.

version 2.019 - June 2011

1. Bug fix.  If base quality recalibration isn't used the filenames
were incorrectly generated.  The filenames were originally constructed
by replacing recal with, for example, unaligned.  In the absence of
base quality recalibration, this fails.

version 2.018 - June 2011

1. Bug fix in Mosaik2 sort.

version 2.017 - June 2011

1. Bug fix with determining whether or not to delete input files.

version 2.016 - May 2011

1. GATK base quality recalibration can be turned off if requested
with the -no-bq-recal flag.

version 2.015 - June 2011

1. Allowed the user to specify the number of threads for an alignment
job (this will modify the -p option in Mosaik as well as the number of
processors requested in the script).

version 2.014 - June 2011

1. Allowed the user to specify a wall time for the job.

version 2.013 - June 2011

1. Allowed the user to specify the node to use, -node.

2. Allowed the user to request a particular queue, -queue.

version 2.012 - June 2011

1. Update BCM duplicate marker when read from -software.  The Picard
version is extracted from the path and the command is set accordingly.

version 2.011 - June 2011

1. Added base quality recalibration and duplicate marking to the list
of tools that can be entered using the -software option.

version 2.010 - June 2011

1. Added Mosaik components to the -software list.

version 2.009 - May 2011

1. Ensured that the existence of all required software components
is checked.

version 2.008 - May 2011

1. Modification to handling input rod files for GATK.

version 2.007 - May 2011

1. Further modification to handling reference from -software.

version 2.006 - May 2011

1. Fixed bug with reference in -software option.

version 2.005 - May 2011

1. Allowed dbSNP and reference to be added by way of the input
software file (-software).

version 2.004 - May 2011

1. Included the -software option.  This allows the paths to all
tools to be defined in a separate text file.  This file is read
in and ensures that the paths hard-coded do not need to be
modified if running on a different system.

version 2.003 - May 2011

1. Implemented the FindBin module to determine where all of the code
for the pipeline is kept.  This ensures that if the pipeline is
downloaded to a different location, the location of all of the
perl files is known.

version 2.002 - May 2011

1. Modified handling of copying files back to the local disk in the
event of a tool failure.

version 2.001 - May 2011

1. Included variant calling with freeBayes.

version 2.000 - May 2011

1. A cleaned version of the pipeline.  Not all tools have been ported
over to this cleaned version as yet, but Mosaik v2 compatibility has
been included.
